otanalysis.view.class_toggle module

Plan to build a custom Toggle button

class otanalysis.view.class_toggle.QtToggle(width, height, bg_color, circle_color, active_color, text, active_text, animation_curve=14)[source]

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QCheckBox

Toggle Button instantiation class in the Qt interface

Parameters
QCheckBox: heritage

inheritance of the checkBox widget class

Initialization of the Toggle object

Parameters
width: int

horizontal size of the button

height: int

height of the button

bg_color: str

background color when the button is in the OFF position

circle_color: str

color of the animation circle for the toggle state change

active_color: str

color when the button is in the ON position

text: str

text when the button is OFF

active_text: str

text when the button is ON

animation_curve: object

QEasingCurve.OutQuint by default animation during the transition of the button between two states

circle_position

getter of the button position

hitButton(pos: PyQt5.QtCore.QPoint)[source]

Position of the circle in the rectangle forming the toggle button

Parameters
pos: object

object representing a point in the plane

paintEvent(e)[source]

Drawing of the button including a rectangle with a point moving inside according to a particular transition (left end to right end). It also has a word centered on the opposite side of the point representing the action to be performed

start_transition(value)[source]

movement of the button according to the change of state

Parameters
value: bool

Button status

Parameters

abscissa_data: bool
